qas.question: How much in contributions did the Labour party get from January to Marrch 2008?
How far was the party in debt for the same time period?
How far was the Conservative party in debt?
What was not a major problem for the Labour Party during this period?
When did the Labour Party receive 6 million in donations?
When was the Conservative party 17 million in debt?
Who increased the influence of activists?

context: <b3_0>Finance<b3_0/> proved a major problem for the Labour Party during this period; a "cash for peerages" scandal under Blair resulted in the drying up of many major sources of donations. Declining party membership, partially due to the <b4_0>reduction of activists' influence<b4_0/> upon policy-making under the reforms of <b7_0>Neil Kinnock<b7_0/> and Blair, also contributed to financial problems. Between <b5_0><b6_0>January and March 2008<b6_0/><b5_0/>, the Labour Party received just over <a0_0>£3 million<a0_0/> in donations and were <a1_0>£17 million<a1_0/> in debt; compared to the Conservatives' £6 million in donations and <a2_0>£12 million<a2_0/> in debt.
